response.job_title: Industrial Engineer | Experienced in marketing technologies and data analysis |
response.summary:
I am a engineering professional and data specialist with experience in the technology and operational teams, optimizing processes that allow decision making in different projects, while also solving problems, giving support and meaningful insights through analytics.  I have worked in companies with a global focus and high level of multiculturalism, where the second language (English) is critical for the evolution of projects.

I have experience since 2019 in global companies such as SAP, Stanley Black & Decker, Puig and BASF. I am interested in languages and cultures, as well as working in dedicated teams and generate affinity to achieve the objectives in the best way, so I managed to be trilingual (native Spanish, English and German) . That's how I got a scholarship in 2018 for an exchange and internship in Germany together with DAAD. My most recent position was at SAP, supporting the SAP University Alliances Iberoamerican team Manager while she was on her maternity leave.

I have many hobbies, I have always liked to draw and design, I even know how to do it digitally. I am interested in the world of software development and participated in the ICT Mission 2022 program to learn about these topics. I love dancing and I am dedicated to improving my lifestyle.
| Data Specialist | Marketing Technologies | Data Analytics | Business Intelligence | Marketing | Digital Development |
response.skills: Posicionamiento de marca, Gestión de proyectos, Comunicaciones estratégicas, trabajo en equipo, BI de SAP, Bynder, Marketing tecnológico, Storytelling, Análisis de datos, Analítica de datos, Análisis de marketing, Microsoft Excel, Administración de recursos digitales, Inglés, Medios digitales, Comercio electrónico, Marketing, Administración de bases de datos, Retail, Microsoft Office

profile_positions.description: In my role as Country Manager, I was temporarily supporting a maternity leave. My responsibilities include creating a regional Go-To-Market concept for 2023-2025, rolling out the SAP UA portfolio in Iberoamérica, managing relationships with SAP UA members as an account manager, and piloting an engagement model with industry partners to enhance the talent pipeline for SAP and its ecosystem. I also was responsible for preparing and supporting the SAP UA Academic Community Conferences, info sessions, competitions, webinars, and other events.
profile_positions.title: YP - Regional Manager SAP University Alliances in Latin America, Portugal and Spain

profile_positions.description:
Through the creation of Dashboards in the SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) tool, I report the SAP Academy programs data such as demographics, class reporting, budget and associate performance.

I manage programs, project, staff and associate databases in Airtable. This includes questionnaire formats and automations within the databases to improve process times and reduce manual work.

I supported the social media team with a content calendar and insights reports of the social media accounts.

I support the Virtual Reality program with a logistical system for assigning Headsets and communicating with participants.
profile_positions.title: YP - Data Management Specialist

profile_positions.description:
I supported the DAM (Digital Asset Management) team, the team in charge of the digital material of the products in the company, in the handling of digital tools such as formulas in Excel and Automator to obtain more effective results.

I managed the digital material of the Stanley brand globally in the Bynder system, through Workfront requests for the company and its new products, updates and web pages, managing to create a digital library for the company of about 300,000 items. 

Awards: "Digital Ninja Award" For proposing digital tools to generate templates and quick ways to rename documents. "You've done something great award" for renaming 40,000 images by automating the process.
profile_positions.title: Digital Asset Analyst

profile_positions.description: I created sales reports to verify and analyze the performance of products in the Ecommerce channel of stores such as Falabella, Blind and Farmatodo, using Excel and Canva. I coordinated and followed up on the digital channel implementations of different e-retailers.
profile_positions.title: Digital Marketing Coordinator

profile_positions.description: Oversaw and enhanced the private label perfume pages of each retailer's product website (Brilliant basics and assets). Managed and organized the database of digital product material for clients, campaigns and teams.
profile_positions.title: Marketing Intern

profile_positions.description:
BASF Colors & Effects 
Supported the creation of reports in Excel and Power Query: product database and sales information summaries. I analyzed the existing processes and practices in the Demand Mangement team in the product allocation process.
profile_positions.title: Internship in Global Market demand Management

company.name: SAP
company.description:
At SAP, our purpose is to help the world run better and improve people’s lives. Our promise is to innovate to help our customers run at their best. SAP is committed to helping every customer become a best-run business. We engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality, and spread opportunity across borders and cultures. Together, with our customers and partners, we can transform industries, grow economies, lift up societies, and sustain our environment. 

SAP privacy statement for followers: www.sap.com/sps
